intro: Tylophora juventas, commonly known as the "immortality vine," is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. Its botanical significance lies in its traditional use in herbal medicine, particularly for its potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. Tylophora juventas thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories.
